# Documentation Review Guidelines

## Tone and Audience

- Keep documentation concise and scannable.
- Documentation for users must avoid heavy technical jargon.
- Documentation for developers can be more technical, but should stay clear and direct.

## Clarity and Structure

- Prefer short paragraphs and bullet lists.
- Explain why something matters when it is not obvious.
- Avoid redundant or filler text.

## Formatting and Linting

- Format Markdown with Prettier.
- Ensure Markdown passes markdownlint.
